frameDefinitions: The number of entities that make up the Set changes from an Initial_number to a Final_number.
This frame is concerned with nouns denoting a part or parts of a Whole entity .
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.
frameExamples: How has the <t>proliferation</t> of cellular telephones affected your amateur mobile operation? INI INI
Kim forgot a large <t><fex name='Part'>part</fex></t> of the story.
I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
She <t>scattered</t> his ashes in the bay.
listRoleDefinitions: The group of entities, possibly construed as a collective, whose number changes.
The number of entities by which the <fen>Set</fen> increases or decreases.
The number of entities in the <fen>Set</fen> afterwards.
The initial number of entities in the <fen>Set</fen>.
A description that presents the <fen>Set</fen>'s state before the change in the number of entities making it up as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Set</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change in number occurs.
A location where the <fen>Set</fen> changes in number.
A <fen>Part</fen> of a larger <fen>Whole</fen>.
An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> disperses or scatters the <fen>Individuals</fen>.
The <fen>Individuals</fen> are scattered by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An event or force that causes that <fen>Individuals</fen> to disperse.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are dispersed.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the dispersing event happens.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The union's membership</fex> has dwindled from 1.5 million in 1979 to a little more than 600000 today.
Jaffna's student population has dwindled <fex>by more than a hundred</fex>.
Church of England baptisms have dwindled from 365000 in 1940 <fex>to 150000 in 1995</fex>.
The number of Medline searches has greatly proliferated <fex>from 7 million</fex> to 120 million.
The human population has dwindled <fex>from being world dominators</fex> to simple survivors.
Oh, my aching software: Worms and viruses proliferated <fex>in 2003</fex>.
Sergey had  <fex>half</fex> of the pizza for breakfast.
Sergey had  half <fex>of the pizza</fex> for breakfast.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
separate the yolks <fex>from the whites</fex>.
<fex>The researcher</fex> divided subjects into groups.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
